thread.title: S & T Bancorp Upgraded to Buy by Zacks (STBA)
thread.title_full: S & T Bancorp Upgraded to Buy by Zacks (STBA)

title: S & T Bancorp Upgraded to Buy by Zacks (STBA)
text:
Tweet 
Zacks upgraded shares of S & T Bancorp (NASDAQ:STBA) from a hold rating to a buy ratingin a report published onFriday, AnalystRatings.Net reports. Zacks currently has $34.00 price target on the financial services provider’s stock. 
According to Zacks, “S & T BANCORP, INC. is a bank holding company which is engaged in general banking business. The Bank is a full service bank with its main office in Indiana, Pennsylvania, providing service to its customers through a branch of 34 offices located in Armstrong, Allegheny, Indiana, Jefferson, Clearfield and Westmoreland counties. The Bank’s services include accepting time and demand deposit accounts, making secured and unsecured commercial and consumer loans, providing letters of credit, and offering discount brokerage services, personal financial planning and credit card services. “ 
Shares of S & T Bancorp ( NASDAQ:STBA ) opened at 30.17 on Friday. S & T Bancorp has a 52 week low of $23.07 and a 52 week high of $32.88. The stock’s 50 day moving average is $30.72 and its 200 day moving average is $28.99. The stock has a market cap of $1.05 billion and a price-to-earnings ratio of 15.76. 
S & T Bancorp (NASDAQ:STBA) last released its quarterly earnings data on Tuesday, July 21st. The financial services provider reported $0.52 EPS for the quarter, beating the Thomson Reuters consensus estimate of $0.48 by $0.04. During the same quarter last year, the business earned $0.49 EPS. The business had revenue of $62.20 million for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $59 million. On average, equities analysts forecast that S & T Bancorp will post $2.04 EPS for the current year. 
The business also recently announced a dividend, which was issued on Thursday, August 20th. Investors of record on Thursday, August 6th were paid a $0.18 dividend. The ex-dividend date of this dividend was Tuesday, August 4th. 
In related news, Director James Thomas Gibson sold 75,000 shares of S & T Bancorp stock in a transaction that occurred on Thursday, July 23rd. The shares were sold at an average price of $32.54, for a total value of $2,440,500.00. The transaction was disclosed in a legal filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is available through the SEC website . 
STBA has been the topic of several other research reports. Piper Jaffray started coverage on shares of S & T Bancorp in a research note on Thursday, June 4th. They issued an overweight rating on the stock. RBC Capital raised their target price on shares of S & T Bancorp from $29.00 to $32.00 and gave the company a sector perform rating in a research report on Wednesday, July 22nd. Finally, Keefe, Bruyette & Woods restated a buy rating on shares of S & T Bancorp in a report on Thursday, July 23rd. Four investment analysts have rated the stock with a hold rating and two have assigned a buy rating to the company’s stock. S & T Bancorp presently has a consensus rating of Hold and an average target price of $32.00. 
S&T Bancorp, Inc. ( NASDAQ:STBA ) is a bank holding company. The Company operates through its wholly owned subsidiaries, including   S&T operates   which   deposits,   services; Wealth Management, which offers   deeds, guardian and custodian of employee benefits and other trust and brokerage services, as well as a registered investment advisor that manages private investment accounts for individuals and institutions, and Insurance, includes an insurance agency offering commercial property and casualty insurance, group life and health coverage, employee benefit solutions and personal insurance lines.
